# dokploy_composes (Data Source)

Fetches all Dokploy compose stacks, optionally filtered by environment.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `environment_id` (String) Optional environment ID to filter compose stacks. If not provided, returns all compose stacks across all environments.

### Read-Only

- `composes` (Attributes List) List of compose stacks. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--composes))

<a id="nestedatt--composes"></a>
### Nested Schema for `composes`

Read-Only:

- `app_name` (String) The app name used for Docker service naming.
- `auto_deploy` (Boolean) Whether auto-deploy is enabled.
- `compose_path` (String) Path to the docker-compose.yml file in the repository.
- `compose_status` (String) Current status: idle, running, done, or error.
- `compose_type` (String) The compose type: 'docker-compose' or 'stack' for Docker Swarm.
- `created_at` (String) Timestamp when the compose stack was created.
- `description` (String) Description of the compose stack.
- `environment_id` (String) The environment ID this compose stack belongs to.
- `id` (String) The unique identifier of the compose stack.
- `isolated_deployment` (Boolean) Whether isolated deployments are enabled.
- `isolated_deployments_volume` (Boolean) Whether isolated deployment volumes are enabled.
- `name` (String) The display name of the compose stack.
- `randomize` (Boolean) Whether service names are randomized.
- `server_id` (String) Server ID the compose stack is deployed to.
- `source_type` (String) The source type: github, gitlab, bitbucket, gitea, git, or raw.
